lexUnit.name: collude.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: come to a secret understanding; conspire

sentence.text: When Winchelsey died in 1313 , therefore , pope and king colluded to ensure that just such a successor was appointed .
Buyers can also collude to strengthen their position vis-a-vis sellers .
Yet you still have Church and State colluding to tell young people at what age they can buy condoms and limiting access to such contraceptives in the age of AIDS .
Basically it was about certain British officials allegedly colluding in drug-test avoidance at some meetings in the early eighties .
So his parents had colluded in persuading Edwin that there was a worthwhile job he could still do .
And seventeen employers were also prosecuted for colluding in the offences .
Was she colluding in his tax evading ?
For example , if airlines share a computerized reservation system this makes it easy to monitor and collude on prices .
In order to achieve its dogma of privatizing the coal industry , it colluded with British Coal to close thirty one pits .

Jacques Donzelot has argued that women actively colluded with doctors because of the new-found status that accrued to them within the family as educators of their children and as medical auxiliaries .
2429 Marienburg secedes from the Empire after the Burgomeisters collude with Emperor Dieter IV to secure their independence in return for Marienburger gold .
A handful of national splittists in Xinjiang , colluding with national splittists outside Xinjiang , have stepped up their splitting activity . "
The party had even colluded with the Tories to attempt to thwart SNP assaults on ` Thatcher 's right to ruin Scotland " .
On June 21 the West German police announced that they had started investigations into allegations that Honecker and Mielke had actively colluded in offering RAF activists refuge in East Germany .
Under a prohibition system such as that of the EEC , it would have to be established that the firms had colluded .
If firms are to collude tacitly , they must somehow choose prices and outputs which are sustainable by a credible punishment strategy that also has to be tacitly agreed upon .
It depends how much the adults collude and what their bank balances are looking like .
